class.name: ScriptCreateDialog
class.brief_description: The Editor's popup dialog for creating new [Script] files.
class.description: The [ScriptCreateDialog] creates script files according to a given template for a given scripting language. The standard use is to configure its fields prior to calling one of the [method Window.popup] methods. [codeblock] func _ready(): dialog.config("Node", "res://new_node.gd") # For in-engine types dialog.config("\"res://base_node.gd\"", "res://derived_node.gd") # For script types dialog.popup_centered() [/codeblock]

method.name: config
method.description: Prefills required fields to configure the ScriptCreateDialog for use.

signal.name: script_created
signal.description: Emitted when the user clicks the OK button.
